subject: Re: [junit] How to write the assertion?
msgSnippet: ... To write assertions, you need to understand what the method should do. You need to understand the results to expect. You do not need to understand how
messageBody:
hdpoliya wrote:

> To write test cases with Junit, we have write assertion for the tested
> method. Then how to write an accurate assertion. Do we have to
> understand the origin method? If so, then what's the difference between
> testers and developers?

To write assertions, you need to understand what the method should do.
You need to understand the results to expect. You do not need to
understand how those results happen.

In many agile teams, the separation between programmer and tester
becomes very small over time.

> I've read some samples of junit. They are easy to think out an
> assertion.
>
> But for most methods, how can we decide whether write an assertion with
> the original method or assertTrue(/assertFalse)?
> Please give me some help on writing the assertion.

I imagine you need to write assertions for a specific method in your
system. Think about that method. I claim it works. How do you check my
claim? What do you look for? Imagine you can do anything you want to
test it, what would you do?
